messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re:Family size
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/23/04 6:44:19 PM, contact@boardprep.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/23/04 6:44:19 PM, contact@... writes:

<< They found that that it takes approximately four adults for every one child
to lead the least distressed life. You're almost there Kathryn! >>

Years ago when I was pregnant with Holly we took Kirby and Marty to
Disneyland. We took another friend with us (a young man who had just been discharged
from the Air Force) so that we would have more adults than children. We paid
his airfare and entry just to help us with two boys. It was GLORIOUS.
Peaceful. People weren't grumpy with each other. I could take a nap each day.

Sandra

messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] Re:Family size
messages.msgSnippet: It s not  easy even with an only child. ********************** Julian is an only child with three parents who spend lots of time with him individually almost
messages.messageBody:
It's not easy even with an only child.



**********************
"Julian is an only child with three parents who spend lots of time with him
individually almost every day. I always thought those were good odds.
Three
people aren't likely to be losing it at any one time. :)"

Kathryn

This reminds me of a study performed by The Re-evaluation Co-counseling
organization headquartered in Portland Oregon (I think) whose philosophy
includes deep respect for children's thoughts, feelings, needs and desires.
They found that that it takes approximately four adults for every one child
to lead the least distressed life. You're almost there Kathryn!

[

messages.subject: Re:Family size
messages.msgSnippet: It s not  easy even with an only child. ********************** Julian is an only child with three parents who spend lots of time with him individually almost
messages.messageBody:
It's not easy even with an only child.



**********************
Julian is an only child with three parents who spend lots of time with him
individually almost every day. I always thought those were good odds. Three
people aren't likely to be losing it at any one time. :)

Kathryn

Kathryn Baptista, Conference Coordinator

Come to the Live and Learn Unschooling Conference August 27-29 in Peabody,
MA!
For more information, go to www.LiveandLearnConference.org
